name: Sapporo Soup Curry
description: Sapporo Soup Curry is a colorful dish of fall-off-the-bone chicken and crispy flash-fried vegetables in a light broth with curry powder and garam masala. Originating in Hokkaido, this comforting soup is a relatively new addition to the Japanese curry scene.

video.name: Sapporo Soup Curry with Cuckoo Multi Cooker ICOOK Q5 PREMIUM
video.description:
Originated in Sapporo, Hokkaido, a northernmost island of Japan, Soup Curry is a light curry flavored soup served with tender chicken chicken and colorful vegetables that are flash fried to give the vibrant colors. 

* To learn more about this amazing Cuckoo Multi Cooker ICOOK Q5 PREMIUM and to enter for your chance to win one of THREE (3) Cuckoo Multi Cooker ICOOK Q5 PREMIUM, please click here ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/WinCuckoo 
* Buy Cuckoo Multi Cooker ICOOK Q5 PREMIUM on Amazon ‚ñ∂ https://amzn.to/2v9449W

Thank you Cuckoo for sponsoring this video and giveaway! #SPON #AD 

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 01:21

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/SoupCurry

Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 1 hour 20 minutes
Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins
Servings: 4
 
Ingredients:

- For Steamed Rice -
2 rice cooker cups uncooked Japanese short grain rice
water (Fill up till 2 cup line)

- For Soup Curry -
1 onion
1 carrot
1 package shimeji mushrooms
3 cloves garlic
1 inch ginger
2.5 lb chicken thighs (6 pieces)
1 tsp kosher salt (for chicken)
freshly ground black pepper
¬Ω Tbsp olive oil
1 Tbsp unsalted butter
¬º tsp kosher salt (for onion)
3 cups chicken stock/broth
1 Tbsp dry basil
1 bay leaf
1 tsp kosher salt (to taste)
1 tsp soy sauce

- Seasonings -
1 piece Japanese curry roux (= 1 small square block)
1 Tbsp curry powder
1 tsp garam masala
1 Tbsp tomato paste
1 Tbsp honey
1 ¬Ω Tbsp mango chutney

- For Additional Vegetables -
1 cup neutral flavor oil (vegetable, canola, etc)
1 russet potato
¬Ω red bell pepper
2 okra
2 Japanese/Chinese eggplant
2 inches lotus root (renkon)
2 oz kabocha squash (60 g)

Instructions with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/SoupCurry

recipeIngredient: 1¬Ω cups uncooked Japanese short-grain white rice
1 knob ginger ((1-inch, 2.5 cm per knob; peeled))
2.5 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs ((about 6 pieces))
1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt ((for the chicken))
¬º tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt ((for the onion))
1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt ((to taste))
1 cube Japanese curry roux ((1 small square block))

recipeInstructions.text: Before You Start: For this recipe, I use a multi-cooker to steam the rice, stir-fry the ingredients, and pressure cook the soup curry. For Instant Pot instructions, see the end Notes. Alternatively, you can use a pot on the stove to saut√© and cook the soup curry. For the steamed rice, you could also cook it in a rice cooker, pot on the stove, donabe, and Instant Pot; please see those recipes for how much water to use. Note that the rice-to-water ratio is 1 to 1.1 (or 1.2) for short-grain white rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Before You Start: For this recipe, I use a multi-cooker to steam the rice, stir-fry the ingredients, and pressure cook the soup curry. For Instant Pot instructions, see the end Notes. Alternatively, you can use a pot on the stove to saut√© and cook the soup curry. For the steamed rice, you could also cook it in a rice cooker, pot on the stove, donabe, and Instant Pot; please see those recipes for how much water to use. Note that the rice-to-water ratio is 1 to 1.1 (or 1.2) for short-grain white rice.

itemListElement.text: Rinse and wash 1¬Ω cups uncooked Japanese short-grain white rice 3 times and drain well. For step-by-step instructions of how to measure and rinse, see my post on how to make rice.¬†Place the rice in the inner pot of the cooker, then add water up to the 2-cup water line. Close the lid.
itemListElement.name: Rinse and wash 1¬Ω cups uncooked Japanese short-grain white rice 3 times and drain well. For step-by-step instructions of how to measure and rinse, see my post on how to make rice.¬†Place the rice in the inner pot of the cooker, then add water up to the 2-cup water line. Close the lid.

itemListElement.text: Select the Rice menu on the multi-cooker, then set the steam time to 8 minutes. Press the Cook button. When cooking is completed, warming will start. Fluff up the rice with a rice scooper.¬†Tip: Adjust the cooking time and water according to your personal taste.
itemListElement.name: Select the Rice menu on the multi-cooker, then set the steam time to 8 minutes. Press the Cook button. When cooking is completed, warming will start. Fluff up the rice with a rice scooper.¬†Tip: Adjust the cooking time and water according to your personal taste.

itemListElement.text: Gather all the ingredients. Measure the seasonings ahead of time: 1 cube Japanese curry roux, 1 Tbsp Japanese curry powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 Tbsp tomato paste, 1¬Ω Tbsp mango chutney, and 1 Tbsp honey.
itemListElement.name: Gather all the ingredients. Measure the seasonings ahead of time: 1 cube Japanese curry roux, 1 Tbsp Japanese curry powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 Tbsp tomato paste, 1¬Ω Tbsp mango chutney, and 1 Tbsp honey.

itemListElement.text: Dice 1 onion.
itemListElement.name: Dice 1 onion.

itemListElement.text: Peel and cut 1 carrot into small pieces. I use the rangiri Japanese cutting method to increase the surface area so the carrot cooks evenly and faster and absorbs more flavor.
itemListElement.name: Peel and cut 1 carrot into small pieces. I use the rangiri Japanese cutting method to increase the surface area so the carrot cooks evenly and faster and absorbs more flavor.

itemListElement.text: Mince 3 cloves garlic and grate 1 knob ginger.
itemListElement.name: Mince 3 cloves garlic and grate 1 knob ginger.

itemListElement.text: Open 1 package shimeji mushrooms and cut off the bottom root end. Separate the mushrooms into small clusters.
itemListElement.name: Open 1 package shimeji mushrooms and cut off the bottom root end. Separate the mushrooms into small clusters.

itemListElement.text: Pat dry 2.5 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs with paper towels to remove any moisture. Season the chicken with 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
itemListElement.name: Pat dry 2.5 lb bone-in skin-on chicken thighs with paper towels to remove any moisture. Season the chicken with 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.

itemListElement.text: Set the cooker to Browning Fry, level 6 for 30 minutes. You can add more minutes later if you need extra time.
itemListElement.name: Set the cooker to Browning Fry, level 6 for 30 minutes. You can add more minutes later if you need extra time.

itemListElement.text: Heat ¬Ω Tbsp extra virgin olive oil and brown the chicken, skin side down, for 5 minutes each side, or until golden brown. Don‚Äôt crowd the pot, and brown the chicken in batches, if necessary.
itemListElement.name: Heat ¬Ω Tbsp extra virgin olive oil and brown the chicken, skin side down, for 5 minutes each side, or until golden brown. Don‚Äôt crowd the pot, and brown the chicken in batches, if necessary.

itemListElement.text: After the bottom side is nicely browned, flip to cook the other side. Then, transfer the chicken to a plate and continue with the next batch. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: After the bottom side is nicely browned, flip to cook the other side. Then, transfer the chicken to a plate and continue with the next batch. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Add the diced onion and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter. Add ¬º tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt. Saut√© until translucent, about 7‚Äì8 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add the diced onion and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter. Add ¬º tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt. Saut√© until translucent, about 7‚Äì8 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add the garlic and ginger and mix all together.
itemListElement.name: Add the garlic and ginger and mix all together.

itemListElement.text: Add the curry roux, curry powder, and garam masala. Give it a quick stir.
itemListElement.name: Add the curry roux, curry powder, and garam masala. Give it a quick stir.

itemListElement.text: Add the tomato paste and saut√© until fragrant.
itemListElement.name: Add the tomato paste and saut√© until fragrant.

itemListElement.text: Add the honey and mango chutney and mix all together.
itemListElement.name: Add the honey and mango chutney and mix all together.

itemListElement.text: Gradually add half of the 3 cups chicken stock/broth, scraping the brown bits on the bottom of the pot. Transfer the chicken back to the pot.
itemListElement.name: Gradually add half of the 3 cups chicken stock/broth, scraping the brown bits on the bottom of the pot. Transfer the chicken back to the pot.

itemListElement.text: Add the carrots, shimeji mushrooms, and rest of the chicken stock.
itemListElement.name: Add the carrots, shimeji mushrooms, and rest of the chicken stock.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 Tbsp dry basil and 1 bay leaf. Gently mix all together.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 Tbsp dry basil and 1 bay leaf. Gently mix all together.

itemListElement.text: Close the lid and set cooker to Multi Cook, level 9 for 35 minutes. For Instant Pot directions, see the end Notes below.
itemListElement.name: Close the lid and set cooker to Multi Cook, level 9 for 35 minutes. For Instant Pot directions, see the end Notes below.

itemListElement.text: Once pressure cooking is done, open the lid and stir.¬†Add 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and 1 tsp soy sauce.
itemListElement.name: Once pressure cooking is done, open the lid and stir.¬†Add 1 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and 1 tsp soy sauce.

itemListElement.text: Taste and adjust the flavor.
itemListElement.name: Taste and adjust the flavor.

itemListElement.text: Lotus root: Thinly slice 2 inches lotus root (renkon) and soak in water (or ideally in 2 cups water + 1 tsp of rice vinegar) for 10 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Lotus root: Thinly slice 2 inches lotus root (renkon) and soak in water (or ideally in 2 cups water + 1 tsp of rice vinegar) for 10 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Bell pepper: Remove the seeds from ¬Ω red bell pepper and cut into 4 wedges.
itemListElement.name: Bell pepper: Remove the seeds from ¬Ω red bell pepper and cut into 4 wedges.

itemListElement.text: Okra: Remove the hard top edges from 2 okra and cut in half lengthwise.
itemListElement.name: Okra: Remove the hard top edges from 2 okra and cut in half lengthwise.

itemListElement.text: Kabocha: Thinly slice 2 oz kabocha squash (cut in half if it‚Äôs too big). If the kabocha is too hard to cut, microwave first for 30 seconds or more.
itemListElement.name: Kabocha: Thinly slice 2 oz kabocha squash (cut in half if it‚Äôs too big). If the kabocha is too hard to cut, microwave first for 30 seconds or more.

itemListElement.text: Potato: Cut 1 russet potato into 6‚Äì8 wedges and soak in water for 10 minutes to remove the starch.
itemListElement.name: Potato: Cut 1 russet potato into 6‚Äì8 wedges and soak in water for 10 minutes to remove the starch.

itemListElement.text: Eggplant: Right before deep-frying (otherwise it‚Äôll change color), cut 2 Japanese or Chinese eggplants in half lengthwise and score the skin side in a crisscross pattern. This creates a nice design and helps to absorb more flavors.
itemListElement.name: Eggplant: Right before deep-frying (otherwise it‚Äôll change color), cut 2 Japanese or Chinese eggplants in half lengthwise and score the skin side in a crisscross pattern. This creates a nice design and helps to absorb more flavors.

itemListElement.text: Make sure to remove moisture from all the vegetables with a paper towel or kitchen towel before frying.
itemListElement.name: Make sure to remove moisture from all the vegetables with a paper towel or kitchen towel before frying.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 cup neutral oil to a frying pan (I use a cast iron pan) or deep, heavy-bottomed pot. Deep- or shallow-fry the vegetables at 350¬∫F (175¬∫C) and drain the excess oil on a paper towel or a wire rack.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 cup neutral oil to a frying pan (I use a cast iron pan) or deep, heavy-bottomed pot. Deep- or shallow-fry the vegetables at 350¬∫F (175¬∫C) and drain the excess oil on a paper towel or a wire rack.

itemListElement.text: Serve the steamed rice in a small bowl or plate. Serve the soup curry separately in an individual soup bowl. Top the soup with the deep-fried vegetables. To eat, pick up some rice with a spoon, scoop some soup curry, and enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Serve the steamed rice in a small bowl or plate. Serve the soup curry separately in an individual soup bowl. Top the soup with the deep-fried vegetables. To eat, pick up some rice with a spoon, scoop some soup curry, and enjoy!

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for a month.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for a month.

review.reviewBody: This is such an amazing soup!! We absolutely love it and look forward to making it all the time. So comforting, satisfying, flavorful, and exciting. We love a lot of your other recipes as well. Thank you!

I love this recipe. I tried Suage+ in Hokkaido back in early 2019, and this one is spot on. 
=) Thank you for the recipe Nami san

This is exactly what I was looking for. It's warm, healthy, fairly light! I loved that I was able to throw in a large variety and quantity of vegetables as my mother buys in bulk and gives us her spare vegetables. After caramelising the onions and chicken (I used drumsticks) in a pan, I cooked it over the stove in a large pot. Definitely not as fancy as that multi-cooker though!

As always, thanks Nami!
